contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} In [[telecommunication]]s, a '''block check character''' (BCC) is a [[character (computing)|character]] added to a [[transmission block]] to facilitate [[Error detection and correction|error detection]]. In [[Longitudinal redundancy check]]ing and [[cyclic redundancy check]]ing, [[block check]] characters are computed for, and added to, each [[message]] block transmitted. This block [[check character]] is compared with a second block check character computed by the receiver to determine whether the transmission is error free. {{DEFAULTSORT:Block Check Character}} [[Category:Control characters]]
